title: Ticket #5919: condor_ssh_to_job doesn't respect -pool arg
description:
condor_ssh_to_job doesn't work from a private schedd talking to a central pool schedd.

Both schedds are 8.5.6 and the pool collector is 8.5.6.

I've verified that auth (condor_ping) and condor_q work properly. I believe at this stage that condor_ssh_to_job does not respect the -pool argument passed to it.

I've replaced hostnames below as some are publicly routable.

Test Case:

iain@iainschedd #]$ condor_ssh_to_job -pool pool.cern.ch -name targetschedd.cern.ch 1573

Expected:

Drops you into the job via ssh.

Actual:

[iain@iainschedd xbatch]$ condor_ssh_to_job -pool pool.cern.ch -name targetschedd.cern.ch 1573 Can't connect to schedd

Current work-around:

Setting the temp env vars for COLLECTOR_HOST works around the problem. As can be seen:

[iain@iainschedd xbatch]$ _condor_COLLECTOR_HOST=pool.cern.ch condor_ssh_to_job -name targetschedd.cern.ch 1573
